page.title: 18St. Julian's, Coolham.
page.content: St. Julian's is a lay Christian Community founded by Florence Allshorn in 1941. Named after the Sussex saint of hospitality, St. Julian's Guest House offers bodily and spiritual refreshment in beautiful, peaceful surroundings in 8 acres of lakeside grounds. The small, simple, wooden chapel, with straw covered floor, has a glass wall behind the altar giving everchanging views of trees, leaves and light. Guests enjoy silent mealtimes, breakfast in bed, wholesome food and fresh milk. There are 16 rooms for 23 guests. The Community lives in the main house and outbuildings. It owns Farleys House for self catering groups, cottages and a tenanted farm. Weekly charges - full Â£84, clergy and professional church workers Â£56 and low income guests Â£28.
